review: I've had the Fire Stick for about 6 months, purchased as an upgrade from my Chromecast since I like Prime Instant Video. The stick works fine on our Panasonic plasma for viewing Netflix and Prime -- as long as my wife is not using our Vizio TV in the other room. The Vizio is a smart unit, with it's own Wi-Fi connectivity. However, whenever I turn on the stick, it turns off my wife's TV. She can turn it back on, but this happens repeatedly, mostly (it seems) when I click the stick's "back" button, "home" button, or circular selection ring button. Personally, I think the problem lies with the Vizio TV, but I am the bad guy each time I want to use the stick. Can anyone help restore domestic tranquility in my home?A few details: both the Chromecast and Fire Stick are plugged into HDMI ports on the Panasonic TV;The use of the Fire Stick remote does not cause the other TV to turn off unless the Fire Stick is turned on, plugged in, and Netflix is brought up;A Netflix movie need not be streaming to cause the problem, but at least the menu of choices must be displayed as a minimum;The other TV does not get turned off every time the remote buttons are pressed, but it happens at least 10% of the time;The Vizio TV need not be streaming in order to get turned off (any mode cam be in use for the TV to get turned off);Both the Vizio TV and the Chromecast/Fire Stick are connected to Wi-Fi via our Xfinity Wi-Fi hub.
